title: Mind-Body Techniques
description: Your gateway to quality cancer-related consumer health information on the Internet.
cleaned_text: Methods are Likely Safe?](https://www.cancer.org/treatment/treatments-and-side-effects/complementary-and-alternative-medicine/complementary-and-alternative-methods-and-cancer/using-cam-safely.html) - The American Cancer Society is the nationwide community-based voluntary health organization dedicated to eliminating cancer as a major health problem by preventing cancer, saving lives, and diminishing suffering from cancer, through research, education, advocacy, and service. The following are mind-body articles: [Macmillan Cancer Support: Mind-Body Therapies](http://www.macmillan.org.uk/information-and-support/coping/complementary-therapies/complementary-therapies-explained/mind-body-therapies.html) - This UK based organization will provide information on various techniques. [MayoClinic: Stress Management](http://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/stress-management/basics/stress-basics/hlv-20049495) - MayoClinic provide a walkthrough of stress basics, stress relief and relaxation techniques. [MedlinePlus: Stress](https://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/stress.html) - Developed by the National Library of Medicine, this consumer health site directs the user to selected online resources on the management and treatment of stress. Also in [Spanish](https://medlineplus.gov/spanish/stress.html). [Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center: About Mind-Body Therapies](https://www.mskcc.org/cancer-care/diagnosis-treatment/symptom-management/integrative-medicine/mind-body) - Learn about aromatherapy, meditation, Quigong, Tai Chi, yoga. [National Cancer Institute: Learning to Relax](https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/coping/feelings/relaxation) - Learn some relaxation skills at this site. Also in [Spanish](https://www.cancer.gov/espanol/cancer/sobrellevar/sentimientos/relajarse). [National Cancer Institute: Psychological Stress and Cancer](http://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/coping/feelings/stress-fact-sheet) - Information on what stress is, how it can affect those suffering from cancer, and how cancer patients can learn to cope with psychological stress. Also in [Spanish](https://www.cancer.gov/espanol/cancer/sobrellevar/sentimientos/hoja-informativa-estres). [National Center for Complementary and Alternative Medicine](https://www.nccih.nih.gov/) - This is the Federal Government's lead agency for scientific research on complementary and alternative medicine. Here you will find a wealth of information on mind and body practices, dietary and herbal supplements, diseases and conditions, treatment and therapies, and clinical trials. [Meditation: In Depth](https://www.nccih.nih.gov/health/meditation-in-depth) [Relaxation Techniques: What You Need Chi: What You Need to Know](https://www.nccih.nih.gov/health/tai-chi-and-qi-gong-in-depth) [Yoga: Need to Know](https://www.nccih.nih.gov/health/yoga-what-you-need-to-know) [Perdue University: The College Student's Guide to Stress Management](https://www.purdueglobal.edu/blog/student-life/college-students-guide-to-stress-management-infographic/) - If you or someone you know is a college student, this infographic will provide good tips on managing stress. Interactive Tutorials / Videos [Cancer Council: Finding Calm During Cancer](https://www.cancercouncil.com.au/901/cancer-information/general-information-cancer-information/complementary-therapies-general-information-cancer-information/meditation-and-relaxation/mindful-meditation/?pp=74162&cc=3338&&ct=35) - Australian psychologist Dr Lisbeth Lane guides you through meditation and relaxation practices. [Dartmouth Relaxation Downloads](http://www.dartmouth.edu/~healthed/relax/downloads.html) - Audio files from Dartmouth College's Student Wellness Center. [Gaiam Yoga Videos](https://www.youtube.com/user/gaiam/videos) - Instructional yoga videos from Rodney Yee, Colleen Saidman and more. [Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center: Multimedia](https://www.mskcc.org/cancer-care/diagnosis-treatment/symptom-management/integrative-medicine/multimedia) - This site will provide audio and videos on various integrative medicine topics. [YouTube playlist: Guided Meditations](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLf8fgiSf96YusKb1Mbxd77CT9RMzZUOzo) - A playlist of guided meditations, each lasting less than 20 minutes, curated by the Resource and Learning Center at Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey.
